farmcity.controller

Class ManageFarmController

  • java.lang.Object
    • farmcity.controller.ManageFarmController

  • public class ManageFarmController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages harvest crop, plant crop functions as well as player's process of leveling up

    • Method Detail

      • getAllPlots

        public java.util.ArrayList<Plot> getAllPlots(java.lang.String username)
        This method fetches all the plots of the current player from the database
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the current player
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Plots that the player has

      • updatePercentages

        public void updatePercentages(Player player)
        This method updates the growth percentage of the crop in player's farm as well as set the status of the plot based on the timePlanted of the Crop on that Plot. The possible status are w (wilted) when the growth percentage is 100% and more than twice the maturity time of the crop has passed since it was planted, e (empty) when there are no crops on the plot, p (planted) when the growth percentage is less than 100% and a crop is planted on the plot or h (ready to harvest) when the growth percentage is 100% and less than twice the maturity time of the crop has passed since it was planted
        Parameters:
        player - The current player's object

      • plantCrop

        public boolean plantCrop(java.lang.String username,
                         InventoryCrop plantedCrop,
                         Plot plot)
                  throws CityException
        This method allows a user to plant a Crop in his Inventory on the specified Plot in his farm. The time that the plot that player wishes to plant to crop on
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the current player
        plot - The plot that player chooses to plant on
        plantedCrop - the Crop that player wants to plant
        Returns:
        Return true if the player succeeded in planting the crop, return false otherwise
        Throws:
        CityException - if the file to be saved to cannot be found

      • harvestCrop

        public java.util.HashMap<Crop,java.lang.Integer> harvestCrop(Player player)
                                                      throws CityException
        This method allows player to return all of the harvestable Crops on all of his Crops, calculates the yields of each crop and sells them to gain money and experience. The plot(s) which had the harvested Crop are set back to empty (e). If the experience combined with the existing experience points exceed the requirement for the next level, promote the player to the corresponding Rank. The player then have additional plot(s) according the his new Rank
        Parameters:
        player - The current player's object
        Returns:
        The details of harvest session (e.g. How much money and experience the player gained from harvesting the crop(s))
        Throws:
        CityException - if the file to be saved to cannot be found

      • clearCrop

        public java.util.ArrayList<Plot> clearCrop(Player player,
                                           Plot plot)
                                    throws CityException
        This method allows player to clear a wilted crop on a chosen wilted plot by using 5 golds from his/ her budget. The plot status is set to empty (e) If the player has less then 5 gold, he/ she will be able to clear all wilted plots free of charge.
        Parameters:
        plot - The plot that has wilted crop which the player want to clear
        player - The current player who wants to clear wilted plots
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of plots to clear
        Throws:
        CityException - if the file to be saved to cannot be found
